name: The Iron Yard Coding BootCamp Experience
tagline: curated by Rob DeSousa & feedback provided by the Houston Class of Summer 2014
body:
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/ddollar/foreman.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/ddollar/foreman) [![Code Climate](https://codeclimate.com/github/ddollar/foreman.png)](https://codeclimate.com/github/ddollar/foreman) ============ ##Getting Started: ### Instructions to install Node.js via Terminal: >1. clone / copy the files to your computer or project folder >2. npm init >3. npm install >4. node server.js ###REST API in order build your own Web App: We used in this project the following tools and frameworks: >- Node Server.js >- Routing >- MVC (Model View Controller) >- Heroku App Server >- Lodash >- Temp DB ###Git instructions for Heroku Live Server via Terminal >1. `git remote remove heroku` \\ If the domain/url/app name changes >2. `git remote add heroku (url)` \\ Add automatically generated URL domain name >3. `git remote -v` \\Get a list view with heroku >4. `heroku create` \\ Create a random Heroku server >5. `git remote -v` \\ This will register a remote git endpoint which should now show Github (origin) and Heroku >6. `heroku ps:scale web=1` \\ To spin-up some resources for your app >7. `git push heroku master` \\ Finally push your code repo up to Heroku (yes it can be pushed to Github OR Heroku!) >8. Anytime you want to push to the same heroku server, you only need to repeat **step 6**. ##Project's we have been working on since the start of the TIY Summer Program. Profile Page using Github API: >https://robdesousa.github.com/TIYP/HW/profile_page.html StopWatch using semi-parallax + Button commands: >https://robdesousa.github.com/TIYP/HW/clock.html ##Tools & Techniques During the last 6 weeks of the TIY immersive 'Front-End Design/Engineering Course', we have learnt the following the tools & techniques: ###Tools: >* Sublime Text: Code Editor >* HTML & CSS: Structure and Styling >* JavaScript: Behaviour >* Routing >* REST API >* Node.js >* Heroku App Server ###Techiques: >*Responsive Design *** ``` function(x){ var x = 1; x = x + 2; } ``` # Test Manage applications
If you have... Install with...
